articles.title: Here’s what the Patriots are doing to make sure their seven-game winning streak reaches eight vs. the Jets in a short week
articles.description:
It's a short week with a division rival coming to town. Here's what Mike Vrabel and players said about preparation.

The post Here’s what the Patriots are doing to make sure their seven-game winning streak reaches eight vs. the Jets in a short week appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots prepare for Jets on November 12 to extend their seven-game winning streak.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes focused training sessions this week for optimal performance.
A win against the Jets would boost local morale and solidify playoff positioning.

articles.title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
articles.description:
"That's what we expect from him. That's what I'm looking for [with] him."

The post Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mason Lohrei responded positively after being benched by Marco Sturm for performance issues.
Sturm emphasized expectations for Lohrei's improvement following the November 10 benching.
Lohrei's performance boost could enhance the Bruins' competitiveness in the NHL season.

articles.title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
articles.description:
The Secretary of the Commonwealth's Office said they have “received complaints from people who have said that they signed these petitions without reading them.”

The post Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Petitioners are accused of misleading voters regarding marijuana repeal signatures.
Complaints received from signers indicate confusion about petition content.
Potential repeal could affect Boston's legal marijuana market and local economy.

articles.title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
articles.description:
All of the top 15 highest-paid state employees hailed from University of Massachusetts.

The post Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9 billion in 2025, marking a significant financial milestone.
All top 15 highest-paid state employees in 2025 are from the University of Massachusetts system.
This concentration of salaries may affect budget allocations for other state services in Boston.

articles.title: Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep
articles.description:
“These suspects could be your neighbors,” a State Police official said Monday.

The post Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts State Police arrested 56 individuals during a three-day child exploitation operation.
The sweep aimed to address local child safety concerns, impacting communities across the state.
Authorities warn that suspects could be living in Boston neighborhoods, raising awareness among residents.

articles.title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
articles.description:
Build snack bags, donate, or sponsor a community meal.

summary: Build snack bags to support local families facing food insecurity in North Shore.
Donate or sponsor a community meal to help those in need this winter.
Engage with local organizations to combat food insecurity affecting Boston residents.

articles.title: SNAP fully funded, Healey says, as she urges residents to use benefits
articles.description:
Gov. Maura Healey tore into President Donald Trump, saying he made a choice to "starve Americans."

The post SNAP fully funded, Healey says, as she urges residents to use benefits appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Gov. Maura Healey confirms SNAP funding is secure for Massachusetts residents.
Healey criticizes Trump for policies affecting food security for Americans.
Residents are encouraged to utilize SNAP benefits to combat food insecurity.
